issues.description: The problem statement refers to a method named `linkParent(Person, Person)` but the template (and solution) declare the corresponding operation as `addParent(Person, Person)`. This naming inconsistency within the specification will confuse students about which method to implement.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the problem statement to consistently refer to `addParent(Person, Person)` instead of `linkParent(Person, Person)`, matching the template and solution code.

issues.description: The problem statement refers to a method named linkParent(Person person, Person parent), but both the template and solution define this operation as addParent(Person person, Person parent). This naming mismatch can confuse students when locating and implementing the intended method.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the description of linkParent in the problem statement to addParent to match the code stubs (or change the stub to linkParent) so that method names are consistent across all artifacts.

issues.description: The problem statement instructs students to invoke endpoints under /api/persons/{personId}/parents, but the template and solution code (and existing tests) expose these endpoints at /persons/{personId}/parents (without the /api prefix). This inconsistency may lead students to call non-existent URLs.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the endpoint path in the problem statement with the code by removing the /api prefix (i.e., use /persons/â€¦) or update the @RequestMapping and tests to include the /api prefix so paths match across artifacts.
